course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Stochastic Models
course.description: Poisson process, Markov process, and Markov decision processes; inventory theory, reliability, queuing theory. Application softwares.
course.prerequisites: IEDA 2510 (prior to 2018-19) OR (IEDA 2520 AND IEDA 2540) OR (MATH 2411 AND MATH 2421)

reviews.author: calcguy
reviews.title: Lecture Notes Are Too Advanced
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: Introduction to Probability Theory
Chapter 2: Random Variables
Chapter 3: Conditional Expectations
Chapter 4: Discrete Time Markov Chain
Chapter 5: The Exponential Distribution and the Poisson Process
Chapter 6: Continuous Time Markov Chain
Chapter 7: Queueing Theory
-----------------------------------------------------
The lecture notes are too complicated in my opinion. The hardest chapter in this course is probably CTMC, and the last chapter can be treated as the pinnacle of this course, as all the contents in earlier chapters will be applied here.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Note that all classes are conducted online using Zoom.
The quality of lecture is quite good, but there are some bad things about lectures. For example, the professor almost never looked at the camera.
Regarding the method of teaching, she explained things in the lecture notes in quite interesting way. I personally think there will not be too much trouble if you skip the lectures, as it is online; there are cloud recordings available after each lecture.
Assuming lecture videos are not available, I think you can still handle this course pretty well, but more efforts are needed if you choose to do so. You may need to refer to external resources from the internet for self-study.
For tutorials, I think you don't really have to attend it, as all the materials will be uploaded to Canvas. The TAâ€™s accent bothers me anyway.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 quizzes throughout the term, held in weeks 4, 7, 11 and 13. No final exam in this course.
The quizzes are non-cumulative, but the knowledge from previous chapters serve as building blocks for the next chapters. Quizzes are normally graded in 1 week.
-----------------------------------------------------
Quiz 1: Chapter 1, 2, 3 (Probability Review)
Statistics:
Mean = 71.4/100
SD = 16.9/100
My score = 93/100
-----------------------------------------------------
Quiz 2: Chapter 4 (DTMC)
Statistics:
Mean = 73/100
SD = 21/100
My score = 87/90 ~ 97/100
-----------------------------------------------------
Quiz 3: Chapter 5, 6 (Poisson Process and CTMC)
Statistics:
Mean = 68.19/100
SD = 17.82/100
Median = 72.5/100
My score = 95/100
-----------------------------------------------------
Quiz 4: Chapter 7 (Queueing Theory)
Statistics:
Mean = 79.9/100
SD = 16.7/100
Median = 82.5/100
My score = 87/100
-----------------------------------------------------
Overall mean = 73.1225/100
Overall SD = 18.18689/100
My total = 93/100
My grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
There is no homework, midterm and final exam in this course. There are only quizzes in this course, so the workload is not high.
If you wish to score high in the quizzes, you need to DO THE (ungraded) HOMEWORK. Sometimes a part of quiz problems resemble the ones from homework, so please don't bottle it. Reviewing tutorials are also necessary. Remember, practice makes perfect.

reviews.author: Mason Mount
reviews.title: Review by a normal student
reviews.comment_content:
The content is not very crazy. The concept is not very difficult. The examples in the notes are easy and suitable for understanding the concepts. However, the quizs are much harder.

Quiz 1: Probability (IEDA2520)
Quiz 2: Discrete Time Markov Chain
Quiz 3: Poisson Process + Continuous Time Markov Chain
Quiz 4: Queuing Theory
reviews.comment_teaching:
The concepts were delivered well. Prof solved the examples step by step.

But she always faced technical problems during the lessons. Therefore, the class were always interrupted.
reviews.comment_grading:
I know a lot of students (local) are below mean. But there are really smart students (non-local) scored very high.

Quiz 1: min: 40 mean: 69 max: 97
Quiz 2: min: 20 mean: 62 max: 100
Quiz 3: min: 22 mean: 58 max: 100
Quiz 4: min: 24 mean: 62 max: 89
reviews.comment_workload:
No workload.

Some practices are provided with solutions. (But the questions are easier than the quizs

reviews.comment_content:
Topics to be discussed include four parts: probability review (Quiz 1), Markov chains (Quiz 2), Poisson processes and continuous time Markov chains (Quiz 3), and queuing theory (Quiz 4).

The content is very abstract and I also don't quite understand when reading the lecture notes. But the applications and questions demonstrated on the notes or exercises are not hard to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 100/100, Mean: 87.9

Quiz 2: 94/100, Mean: 64.7

Quiz 3: 97/100, Mean: 70.9

Quiz 4: 90/100, Mean: 82.6

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is just those 4 quizzes. As a deadline fighter, it is not hard to handle. For me, I didn't attend any classes and I don't use those time to self-study. I just started reading the notes at the night before the quiz for every quiz. Every quiz takes me several hours to study.

The key to getting a good grade is to understand the homework and tutorial exercises. Even if you don't have enough time, at least you need to read those questions and understand them. You don't need to fully completely understand the abstract mathematical concepts. You only need to know how to do the questions.

reviews.author: pangjai
reviews.title: Stochastic Models
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: Introduction to Probability Theory
Chapter 2: Random Variables
Chapter 3: Conditional Expectations
(Chapter 1-3 are reviews of IEDA 2520)

Chapter 4: Discrete-Time Markov Chain
Chapter 5: The Exponential Distribution and the Poisson Process
Chapter 6: Continuous-Time Markov Chain
Chapter 7: Queueing Theory
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Zhang explained the notes clearly, however she speaks a bit slow, you can watch her lectures at x1.5 speed
reviews.comment_grading:
4 quizzes with equal weightings (25% each)

Quiz 1 (Coverage: Chapter 1 - 3)
94/100
Mean: 87.9

Quiz 2 (Coverage: Chapter 4)
93/100
Mean: 64.7

Quiz 3 (Coverage: Chapter 5 - 6 )
92/100
Mean: 70.9

Quiz 4 (Coverage: Chapter 7)
94/100
Mean: 82.6

Overall grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: If you want to get a good grade, then you should do all the homework and tutorial exercises, however, they are not compulsory.
